mvp_phase.name: MVP - Minimum Viable Product
mvp_phase.objective: Deliver core configuration management capabilities with basic security and file-based storage

core_features.description: Create, Read, Update, Delete configuration entries
acceptance_criteria: Support JSON and YAML configuration formats
Provide error handling for malformed configs
Store configs in structured directory hierarchy
Implement file locking for concurrent access
Maintain version history for each config
Commands: get, set, list, delete, version
Override base configs with env-specific values
Validate on read and write operations

functional: All P0 features implemented and tested
CLI can perform all CRUD operations
quality: Integration tests for all CLI commands

external: joi or ajv for schema validation

risks.mitigation: Start with simple env-var approach; document key rotation
Cache compiled schemas; make validation optional

beta_phase.name: BETA - Enhanced Features & Integration
beta_phase.objective: Add enterprise features, extend integrations, harden security, and optimize performance

acceptance_criteria: Support Vault KV v2 secrets engine
Migration tool from file to Vault
Permission model: read, write, delete, encrypt
Log all config mutations (create, update, delete)

enhanced_features.description: HTTP API for remote configuration access
acceptance_criteria: RESTful endpoints for all CRUD operations
LRU cache for frequently accessed configs

extended_integrations.description: Supply routing and rate limit configs

enhancements: Encryption at rest for file storage

exit_criteria: All P0 and P1 bugs resolved

migration_from_mvp.rollback_plan: Automated rollback script available for 30 days post-migration

risks.mitigation: Allocate 2 sprints; maintain file backend as fallback; engage HashiCorp support
Security review after sprint 6; penetration testing; follow OWASP guidelines
Continuous benchmarking; early optimization; scale infrastructure if needed
Extensive migration testing; automated rollback; 24/7 support during migration

v1_phase.name: V1 - Production Release
v1_phase.objective: Deliver production-ready configuration management platform with full feature set, multi-tenancy, and complete LLM DevOps ecosystem integration

acceptance_criteria: Resource quotas and limits per tenant
Notify subscribers of updates via webhooks
Support for resource, action, and context attributes

full_feature_set.description: Detect and alert on config divergence

acceptance_criteria: GraphQL schema for all config operations
Support for complex queries and filters

full_feature_set.description: Extensibility for custom backends and validators
acceptance_criteria: Support for storage, encryption, and validation plugins

features: Inject configs as files or env vars
Init container mode for pre-start configs

functional_completeness: All P0 and P1 features implemented

functional: All deployment modes in production use
quality: Security audit passed with no major findings

risks.mitigation: Extensive security testing; third-party audit; bug bounty program; tenant isolation verification suite
Comprehensive testing; canary deployments; circuit breakers; automated rollback
Early load testing; performance budgets; infrastructure scaling; caching optimization
Staggered integration rollout; dedicated integration team; mock services for testing
Parallel track for docs; technical writer from Beta phase; user feedback sessions
Migration toolkit; dedicated migration support; extended Beta period; rollback procedures

criteria: CLI binary builds for all platforms
CLI, API, Sidecar, SDK all operational
E2E tests for each mode passing

milestones.celebration: Team launch event and public announcement

beta.pass_threshold: 100% of P0, 90% of P1 features working
beta.validation_frequency: End of each sprint + milestone gates

v1.pass_threshold: 100% of P0/P1, 80% of P2 features working

load_testing.v1: Sustained 5000 req/sec for 4 hours + spike to 15000 req/sec

performance_benchmarks.performance_regression_policy: Any > 10% degradation triggers investigation and fix before merge

secret_scanning.pass_criteria: Zero secrets in code or commit history

penetration_testing.frequency: End of Beta, end of V1
penetration_testing.pass_criteria: No critical/high findings, all medium findings remediated

vulnerability_scanning.tool: Trivy for containers, OpenVAS for infrastructure

compliance_validation.pass_criteria: Full compliance with all applicable frameworks

architecture_review.when: End of MVP, significant architecture changes

cryptography_review.when: End of MVP, any crypto changes
cryptography_review.focus: Algorithm selection, implementation correctness, key management

e2e_tests.scope: Complete user workflows across all deployment modes

chaos_engineering.pass_criteria: Service remains available (degraded mode acceptable), no data loss

scenarios: Monitor config changes via audit log
Monitor and alert on config drift

completeness.mvp: README, CLI reference, basic usage examples
completeness.beta: User guide, API reference, admin guide, integration guides
completeness.v1: Complete portal with all guides, tutorials, videos, runbooks

accuracy.pass_criteria: Zero critical errors, < 5 minor errors per document

maintenance.policy: Update docs in same PR as code changes

risk_mitigation.risk: Vault integration complexity delays Beta release

preventive: Allocate 2 full sprints for Vault integration
Create detailed integration plan with milestones
Assign senior engineer with Vault experience
corrective: Maintain file-based backend as production fallback
Defer Vault to V1 if critical issues arise
Reduce Vault feature scope (e.g., only KV v2, basic auth)

preventive: Use established RBAC library (e.g., CASL, AccessControl)
Security review of RBAC design before implementation
detective: Security code review for all RBAC changes
corrective: Immediate hotfix process for security issues
Performance task force if targets missed

preventive: Multi-tenancy architecture review by security expert
Use proven isolation patterns (separate encryption keys, DB schemas)
detective: Penetration testing focused on tenant boundaries
Bug bounty with tenant isolation focus
corrective: Immediate tenant isolation breach response plan

preventive: Thorough design review of reload mechanism
Graceful reload with rollback on failure
detective: Monitoring and alerting on reload failures
Circuit breakers to prevent cascading failures
corrective: Manual override to disable dynamic reload
Incident response plan for reload issues

preventive: Staggered integration schedule (not all at once)
Create mock services for independent testing
detective: Weekly sync with dependent module teams

risk_mitigation.risk: Customer migration failures (MVP to Beta, Beta to V1)
Team skill gaps (Vault, K8s, multi-tenancy, security)

corrective: Bring in consultants for knowledge transfer
Extend timelines if skill development needed
Simplify architecture if too complex for team

preventive: Change control process for scope changes
Defer nice-to-have features to future releases
corrective: Scope reduction meetings if behind schedule
Add resources if justified by business value

mvp_to_beta.trigger: All MVP success criteria met + M3 gate passed

beta_to_v1.trigger: All Beta success criteria met + M8 gate passed
preparation: Beta program review and feedback analysis

v1_to_production.trigger: All V1 success criteria met + M13/M14 gates passed
